repositories.brief_summary: OCaml 5.4.0 release preparation, new C thread registration API, and GC fixes merged
repositories.new_features_summary: New C API for domain-specific thread registration and GC root handling fix
repositories.new_features:
- New **C API function** `caml_c_thread_register_in_domain` enables registering C threads in specific domains rather than just domain 0, with accompanying `caml_find_index_of_running_domain` helper function for looking up domain indices by unique ID ([1f39a26](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/1f39a263bb5bdee11c2ce75b702c4f9254d7c6fd), [f8de0cb](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/f8de0cbb7d7cbb34c69733f66f56e2b60bda4bba), [#14275](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14275))
- Fixed **GC root mishandling bug** in memprof.c that could cause memory corruption ([#14287](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14287))
- Improved **error handling during domain spawn** fixing potential memory leaks and deadlocks when rare errors occur during domain creation ([#12410](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/12410))
- Enhanced **module signature pretty-printing** to preserve `(mod)` and other escaped infix keyword operators in `-dsource` output ([#14279](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14279))
- Updated **C interface manual** with documentation for the new thread registration API and domain lookup functions

repositories.brief_summary: Bug fixes for depext exit codes and pin-depends handling, git submodule checks, and API improvements for repository root handling
repositories.new_features_summary: Fixed depext-only exit codes, pin-depends on simulated pins, git submodule status checks, and made default-invariant modifiable
repositories.new_features:
- Fixed **exit code behavior** for `opam install --depext-only` which previously returned 0 on package conflicts instead of proper error code 20 by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) ([#6516](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6516), fixes [#6488](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6488))
- Fixed **pin-depends handling** in simulated pins where dependencies specified in pin-depends field were being ignored during `opam install --deps-only` operations by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) ([#6611](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6611), fixes [#6610](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6610))
- Added **git submodule status checking** to prevent opam from incorrectly treating repositories as up-to-date when submodules are outdated by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) ([#6153](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6153))
- Made **global `default-invariant` option modifiable** through `opam option` command, previously unchangeable after initialization by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) ([#6730](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6730), fixes [#6724](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6724))

Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) ([#6679](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6679))

repositories.discussions_summary: Design discussions on npm-like workflows, compiler version ranges, inplace pins, and multi-platform lock file improvements
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **npm-like workflow support** discussed by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) proposing `opam add`/`rm` commands for automatic dependency management, `opam ci` equivalent to `opam install --lock`, and project-driven workflow improvements ([#6726](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6726), related to [#6725](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6725), [#6588](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6588))
- **Parallel depext loading** proposed to speed up `opam update` by running system package detection commands in parallel with repository updates once [#6489](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6489) merges, requiring domains support ([#6727](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6727))
- **Inplace pins** proposed to avoid costly copies for local packages in monorepos by treating pins under local switch directory as symlinks and building in-place ([#6725](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6725))
- **Simplified compiler version ranges** discussed with proposals for `opam switch create 5.3` to accept patch versions via formula syntax or wildcard patterns like `5.3.*` ([#6589](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6589))
- **Best-effort multi-platform lock files** proposed to preserve platform-specific disjunctions until `opam lock` runs on each platform, improving cross-platform workflow similar to uv ([#6587](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6587))
- **Transitive pin-depends** debate continued with [Alexander Shopov](https://github.com/shonfeder) favoring recursive behavior where explicit pins override transitively derived pins to address repeated user confusion ([#4003](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/4003))
- **Package variant selection** issue reported by [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) where unpinning `ocaml-variants.5.4.0+trunk` unexpectedly downgraded to `5.3.0+BER` instead of latest stable ([#6731](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6731))
- **macOS and nix-darwin testing** proposed to verify depext support for Nix on macOS and nix-darwin full OS support ([#6723](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6723))

- **Merlin config generation for library parameters** ensuring proper IDE support for OxCaml parameterized libraries ([#12550](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12550))

- **Package build isolation** from project settings to prevent unnecessary compiler rebuilds when changing dune-project version ([#12556](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12556))
- **Duplicate repository name validation** in workspace files to prevent configuration errors ([#12548](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12548))
- **Lint check for changelog entries** ensuring new changes use structured format instead of `.md` files in `doc/changes` ([#12553](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12553))

repositories.discussions_summary: OCaml 5.4.0 readiness tracking, cmdliner 2.0.0 compatibility challenges, and GitHub patch URL instability
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **OCaml 5.4.0 release readiness** tracked extensively in [#27916](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27916) with [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) coordinating platform tools including dune, merlin, lsp-server, odoc, ocamlformat, ppxlib, mdx, utop, and infrastructure components, with [Mathieu Barbin](https://github.com/mbarbin) noting many packages now available in kit-ty-kate/opam-alpha-repository

- **GitHub patch URL instability** addressed in [#28675](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28675) when base v0.15.1 patch checksum changed, with [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) explaining process to download from opam cache and upload to opam-source-archives, demonstrating fragility of external patch dependencies and resolved by [Emilio Jesús Gallego Arias](https://github.com/ejgallego) in [#28676](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28676)

- **conf-package lower bounds** discussed in [#28541](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28541) with [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) noting conf-gmp, conf-llvm, conf-libclang failures, and [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) questioning whether x-maintenance-intent should be added since only latest versions may be relevant

repositories.new_features_summary: Runtime metaprogramming with quotations, full js_of_ocaml integration, block indices stable, DWARF debugging improvements
repositories.new_features:
- **Runtime quotations and metaprogramming** system with new `<[` `]>` quotation syntax and `$` splicing operator for runtime code generation and evaluation, including stage tracking in the type system and AST representation in CamlInternalQuote module by [Andrej Ivašković](https://github.com/Dreian), [Jack Rickard](https://github.com/Skepfyr), and [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) ([#4395](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4395), [#4852](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4852), [#4864](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4864), [#4874](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4874), [#4855](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4855), [#4856](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4856))
- **Full js_of_ocaml compiler** integration imported into oxcaml with JSIR mode for JavaScript compilation and complete backend support by [Jacob Van Buren](https://github.com/jvanburen) and [Leo Lee](https://github.com/smjleo) ([#4730](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4730), [#4737](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4737), [#4739](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4739), [#4743](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4743))
- **Block indices moved to stable** production-ready status with new `%unsafe_get_ptr` and `%unsafe_set_ptr` primitives, improved flattened float field handling with unboxed types, and safety constraint disallowing block indices to `[@atomic]` fields by [Ryan Tjoa](https://github.com/rtjoa) and [Chris Casinghino](https://github.com/ccasin) ([#4827](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4827), [#4824](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4824), [#4826](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4826), [#4828](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4828))
- **CFG terminator simplification** improves compilation of for loops by eliminating redundant jumps through rewriting unconditional jumps to conditional jumps, saving one comparison in simple loops by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) ([#4772](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4772))
- **Lambda layout specialization** enhancement uses externality information to avoid unnecessary `caml_modify` calls in specialized code through more precise GC-ignorability analysis by [Jakub Bachurski](https://github.com/jbachurski) and [Ryan Tjoa](https://github.com/rtjoa) ([#4853](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4853))
- **Polymorphic variants with-bounds** restored with performance fixes addressing pathological fuel algorithm cases and early termination optimization for mode-crossing by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) and [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere) ([#4847](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4847))
- **New `-gdwarf-may-alter-codegen-experimental` flag** enables experimental DWARF debugging features by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) ([#4871](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4871))
- **Backend parameterization** refactoring enables adding new backends without code duplication through optcomp parameterization on backend implementation and asmlink split into three files by [Jacob Van Buren](https://github.com/jvanburen) ([#4825](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4825), [#4838](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4838))
- Fixed **allocation site information** for inlined closures to correct debuginfo showing in OCaml backtraces and Memtrace by [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) ([#4842](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4842), fixes [#4831](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4831))
- Fixed **Multicore.spawn soundness** issue by requiring resource argument to be `contended` and annotating as `once` for flexibility by [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) ([#4875](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4875))
- Fixed **jkind normalization** soundness bug with modalities by tracking modalities when skipping previously seen types by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) ([#4777](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4777))
- Fixed **over-expunged toplevel** by removing Float_u, Iarray, IarrayLabels, Int32_u, Int64_u, Nativeint_u from toplevel as these aren't in compatible Stdlib, spotted during ICFP tutorial by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) ([#4877](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4877))
- Fixed **zero_alloc warning scope** so top-level `[@@@warning "-199"]` works correctly by saving scope where attribute is encountered by [Greta Yorsh](https://github.com/gretay-js) ([#4819](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4819))
- Fixed **atomic fields in mixed blocks** miscompilation by rejecting unsupported cases where atomic fields get wrong field index by [Aspen Smith](https://github.com/glittershark) ([#4868](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4868))
- Fixed **bytecode differentiation** between Bytes.get and String.get needed by js_of_ocaml for different representations by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) ([#4782](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4782))
- Fixed **spill placement** with Name_for_debugger to ensure spilled registers inherit debug names correctly by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) ([#4837](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4837))
- Fixed **ocaml-probes usability** by emitting dummy probe notes when `[%probe_is_enabled name]` appears without corresponding `[%probe name]` to avoid linking errors by [Greta Yorsh](https://github.com/gretay-js) ([#4834](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4834))
- **Register availability analysis** improvements with multiple bug fixes in DWARF tracking for better debug information generation by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) and [Greta Yorsh](https://github.com/gretay-js) ([#4835](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4835), [#4870](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4870))
- **Mode system refactoring** simplifies adding new mode axes with net code reduction (252 additions, 501 deletions) by [Zesen Qian](https://github.com/riaqn) ([#4790](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4790))
- **CI performance improvements** including faster ocamlformat workflow saving ~15 seconds per job with setup-ocaml optimization and reduced macOS CI load by [Jacob Van Buren](https://github.com/jvanburen) ([#4857](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4857), [#4858](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4858), [#4859](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4859))
- **AGENTS.md documentation** moves Claude instructions to separate file for better organization of AI-assisted development by [Jacob Van Buren](https://github.com/jvanburen) ([#4849](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4849))
- **JSIR documentation** added covering JavaScript IR quirks by [Leo Lee](https://github.com/smjleo) ([#4743](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4743))
- **DWARF test filtering** with README and identifier number filtering for stable diffs by [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) ([#4829](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4829))
- **Type path printing** improvement penalizes hash types in error messages so users see `f64` instead of `float#` by [Nailen Matschke](https://github.com/nmatschke) ([#4832](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4832))

repositories.activity_summary: Two open PRs exploring file descriptor type safety with active design discussions

- [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) opened two PRs exploring **type-safe file descriptor handling** in the library: [#128](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring/pull/128) eliminates `Obj.magic` by handling `AT_FDCWD` in C stubs, while draft [#130](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring/pull/130) proposes more invasive changes to introduce type-safe wait functions that differentiate between different return types
- Extended discussion on [#128](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring/pull/128) involving [Thomas Leonard](https://github.com/talex5) and [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) debated the **abstraction boundaries** between OCaml and C representations of file descriptors, with references to David's blog post on [File descriptors are not integers](https://www.dra27.uk/blog/platform/2025/09/30/file-descriptors-are-not-integers.html) and upstream OCaml PR [ocaml/ocaml#14258](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/14258)
- [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) indicated readiness to merge [#128](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring/pull/128) pending end-to-end testing with Eio, while discussion continued on optimal approaches for **flambda optimization** of optional arguments and potential deeper integration into the Eio Linux backend
repositories.discussions_summary: Architecture debate on file descriptor representation and C/OCaml boundary design
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **File descriptor abstraction design** sparked debate on [#128](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring/pull/128) about whether OCaml code should access underlying integer representations: [Thomas Leonard](https://github.com/talex5) argued that kernel interfaces require integer access and avoiding it pushes dangerous code into C, while [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) contended that exposing OCaml integer representations is dangerous because they differ from C integers, with [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) supporting abstract types with safe conversions for Unix.file_descr, C bindings, and logging
- **Windows vs Linux portability** briefly discussed on [#128](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring/pull/128) and [#130](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring/pull/130), with [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) noting file descriptors are definitively integers on Linux while genuinely different on Windows, and [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) mentioning Windows ioring differences would warrant a separate library with Eio integration
- **Compiler optimization** of optional arguments discussed on [#128](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring/pull/128), with [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) noting that flambda 1 and 2 optimize optional arguments better than the current approach suggests, prompting plans to refine the implementation

group_summaries.new_features_summary: Runtime quotations, js_of_ocaml integration, block indices stable, dune 3.20.2, ctypes, lwt, and re library support
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Runtime quotations and metaprogramming** system with new `<[` `]>` quotation syntax and `$` splicing operator for runtime code generation and evaluation, including stage tracking in the type system and AST representation in CamlInternalQuote module by [Andrej Ivašković](https://github.com/Dreian), [Jack Rickard](https://github.com/Skepfyr), and [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4395](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4395), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4852](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4852), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4864](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4864), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4874](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4874), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4855](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4855), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4856](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4856))
- **Full js_of_ocaml compiler** integration imported into oxcaml with JSIR mode for JavaScript compilation and complete backend support by [Jacob Van Buren](https://github.com/jvanburen) and [Leo Lee](https://github.com/smjleo) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4730](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4730), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4737](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4737), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4739](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4739), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4743](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4743))
- **Block indices moved to stable** production-ready status with new `%unsafe_get_ptr` and `%unsafe_set_ptr` primitives, improved flattened float field handling with unboxed types, and safety constraint disallowing block indices to `[@atomic]` fields by [Ryan Tjoa](https://github.com/rtjoa) and [Chris Casinghino](https://github.com/ccasin) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4827](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4827), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4824](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4824), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4826](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4826), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4828](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4828))
- **js_of_ocaml 6.0.1+ox** patches updated with atomic operations support, comprehensive unboxed indexing implementation (1531 lines), local bytes support, and fixes for global deadcode analysis and GitHub issue [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2034](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2034) by [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) ([oxcaml/opam-repository@eeedfd91](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/eeedfd918e54a8741d26af1a4ff2991b21c1045f))
- **ctypes 0.23.0+ox** and **ctypes-foreign 0.23.0+ox** added with bigarray compatibility patches for the oxcaml variant by [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) ([oxcaml/opam-repository@5384cd12](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/5384cd124861e3dcc84786066506e34ba6906f4c))
- **dune 3.20.2+ox**, **dune-rpc 3.20.2+ox**, **dyn 3.20.2+ox**, **ocamlc-loc 3.20.2+ox**, and **ordering 3.20.2+ox** packages introduced with oxcaml-specific patches by [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) ([oxcaml/opam-repository@26cb9899](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/26cb9899ece2c113b2703b1757d02b0b8cb86d96))
- **lwt 5.9.2+ox** library added with oxcaml compatibility patches by [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) ([oxcaml/opam-repository@26cb9899](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/26cb9899ece2c113b2703b1757d02b0b8cb86d96))
- **re 1.14.0+ox** regular expression library added with extensive portability patches (825 lines), iarray support, and fixes for PCRE split functionality by [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) ([oxcaml/opam-repository@26cb9899](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/26cb9899ece2c113b2703b1757d02b0b8cb86d96))
- **zarith 1.14+ox** merged enabling installation of latest TLS libraries by [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) ([oxcaml/opam-repository#14](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/14))
- **CFG terminator simplification** improves compilation of for loops by eliminating redundant jumps through rewriting unconditional jumps to conditional jumps, saving one comparison in simple loops by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4772](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4772))
- **Lambda layout specialization** enhancement uses externality information to avoid unnecessary `caml_modify` calls in specialized code through more precise GC-ignorability analysis by [Jakub Bachurski](https://github.com/jbachurski) and [Ryan Tjoa](https://github.com/rtjoa) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4853](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4853))
- **Polymorphic variants with-bounds** restored with performance fixes addressing pathological fuel algorithm cases and early termination optimization for mode-crossing by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) and [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4847](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4847))
- **New `-gdwarf-may-alter-codegen-experimental` flag** enables experimental DWARF debugging features by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4871](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4871))
- Fixed **allocation site information** for inlined closures to correct debuginfo showing in OCaml backtraces and Memtrace by [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4842](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4842), fixes [oxcaml/oxcaml#4831](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4831))
- Fixed **Multicore.spawn soundness** issue by requiring resource argument to be `contended` and annotating as `once` for flexibility by [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4875](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4875))
- Fixed **jkind normalization** soundness bug with modalities by tracking modalities when skipping previously seen types by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4777](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4777))
- Fixed **over-expunged toplevel** by removing Float_u, Iarray, IarrayLabels, Int32_u, Int64_u, Nativeint_u from toplevel as these aren't in compatible Stdlib, spotted during ICFP tutorial by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4877](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4877))
- Fixed **zero_alloc warning scope** so top-level `[@@@warning "-199"]` works correctly by saving scope where attribute is encountered by [Greta Yorsh](https://github.com/gretay-js) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4819](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4819))
- Fixed **atomic fields in mixed blocks** miscompilation by rejecting unsupported cases where atomic fields get wrong field index by [Aspen Smith](https://github.com/glittershark) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4868](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4868))
- Fixed **bytecode differentiation** between Bytes.get and String.get needed by js_of_ocaml for different representations by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4782](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4782))
- Fixed **js_of_ocaml-compiler 6.0.1+ox** patch application errors by updating iarray primitives and floatarray patches by [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) ([oxcaml/opam-repository#12](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/12))

- [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) opened two PRs in [ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring) addressing **type-safe file descriptor handling**: [ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring#128](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring/pull/128) eliminates `Obj.magic` by handling `AT_FDCWD` in C stubs, while draft [ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring#130](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring/pull/130) proposes type-safe wait functions
- [Thomas Leonard](https://github.com/talex5) provided detailed code review feedback on [ocaml-multicore/eio#575](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/pull/575) for socket options API implementation, focusing on mock improvements and pretty-printer consistency
- [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) indicated readiness to merge [ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring#128](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring/pull/128) pending end-to-end testing with Eio integration
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- File descriptor type safety work in [ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring) ([ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring#128](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring/pull/128)) awaits integration testing with [ocaml-multicore/eio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio), with [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) suggesting deeper integration into Eio Linux backend
- Directory reading performance improvements in [ocaml-multicore/eio#821](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/pull/821) leverage the io_uring backend provided by [ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring), demonstrating substantial performance gains (1.46s to 110ms on Linux)
- Both repositories reference upstream OCaml work on file descriptor handling ([ocaml/ocaml#14258](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/14258)) and [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27)'s blog post on [File descriptors are not integers](https://www.dra27.uk/blog/platform/2025/09/30/file-descriptors-are-not-integers.html)
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **File descriptor abstraction design** sparked debate on [ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring#128](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring/pull/128): [Thomas Leonard](https://github.com/talex5) argued kernel interfaces require integer access and avoiding it pushes dangerous code into C, while [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) maintained that exposing OCaml integer representations is risky due to C/OCaml differences, with [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) supporting abstract types with safe conversions
- **Windows vs Linux portability** discussed on [ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring#128](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring/pull/128) and [ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring#130](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring/pull/130), noting file descriptors are definitively integers on Linux but require different handling on Windows, potentially warranting a separate library for Windows ioring
- **Compiler optimization** of optional arguments explored on [ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring#128](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring/pull/128), with [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) noting flambda 1 and 2 optimize optional arguments better than current assumptions suggest
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Eliminating unsafe operations** emerged as a priority, with [ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring#128](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring/pull/128) and [ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring#130](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring/pull/130) both targeting removal of `Obj.magic` usage, motivated by upstream work in [ocaml/ocaml#14258](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/14258)
- **Type safety vs allocation trade-offs** became central to design discussions on [ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring#130](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring/pull/130), exploring ways to differentiate return types without increasing allocations on fast paths
- **Linux-specific optimizations** gaining attention, with [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) suggesting on [ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring#128](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring/pull/128) that `private int` types for file descriptors and deeper Eio_linux integration could reduce Unix.file_descr usage
- **Performance measurement** highlighted in [ocaml-multicore/eio#821](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/pull/821) with comprehensive benchmarks demonstrating concrete gains from incremental APIs, particularly on io_uring backend
